page.title: 02Land Use
page.content: In the northern part of the area are mixed woods, planted 30 years to settle the unsightly slagheaps, the fields in the north have also been reclaimed and cash crops are grown. Also in the north is a privately owned limestone quarry which is still being worked.To the south of the area are two farms.{Chase Farm}the home of the Shrive family and owned by British Steel Pension Fund.This farm is of 360 acres and the crops are oil seed rape, and grass, some pigs are reared.{ {Stanion Lodge}home of the brooks family and owned by Boughton Estates with similar crops to the previous farm.In the north of the area is{Black {thorn Farm}owned by the Watts Russell family of Benefield.
